description.value:
Release is a Magic Style that uses a Magi-Knight Spell Deck. You will use this deck during the game to draw random cards that will determine the spells you have available for casting. As this is a Magic Style, it also means that selecting Release entirely replaces your ability to choose any other Spell Paths.Â 

If the Magi-Knight Spell Deck hasn't been released yet, or you simply do not own one, you may use a deck of Tarot Cards or Playing Cards using the Card Substitution Table provided below. Release does not gain Spell Paths as a normal Magic Style does and instead follows the aforementioned rules:

  • Collector's Spell Deck: A Magi-Knight is required to have this Magical Implement to cast Release spells.

  • Drawing Spell Cards: At the start of a Combat Encounter, you draw Spell Cards equal to 3 + Reputation Level (minimum 1). This number is also considered your Hand Limit and any Spell Cards in your hand at the end of your turn that are in excess of your Hand Limit are discarded.

  • Release Power: This requires a Standard Action and uses the power of the Spell Card to gain an effect, determined by the Spell Card itself.

    • After playing a Spell Card, it is discarded face up next to your Spell Deck

    • You cannot play Spell Cards if you do not have enough MP to pay the cost for them (as a regular spell) or have no ability to reduce the cost of a spell

    • You cannot cast Spell Cards as Rushed Spells

  • Scaling Value: All Spell Cards have Scaling Value "+X", where "+X" equals the Scaling Value listed on the "Extended Mana & Scaling" table below

    • Scaling Values add a penalty to your +X modifier equal to your Stress Points, if you fail a check with your Endurance Die

    • Scaling Values are always rounded down and are always (minimum 1)

  • Fate Die

    • Sometimes after casting a Spell Card, you will be asked to roll a Fate Die (1d20). No, abilities, shards, modifiers, etc., may influence or alter the roll or result of a Fate Die, except for the Misfortune or Calamity effect

  • Draw a Card

    • At the end of your turn, you draw 1 card. As a Bonus Action, you may additionally draw a card if you are not currently at your Hand Limit

  • Signature Card

    • Instead of gaining Swift Attack at Levels 5 and 10, you instead gain access to a Signature Card. At these levels, choose one card from your Spell Deck. You begin every encounter with that card in your hand and are considered to have "drawn" it for the purposes of your starting hand. You may not choose the Love Card as a Signature Card.

  • Discharge Energy

    • As a Bonus Action you may discard one card from the top of your spell deck to make a Weapon Attack using 1d20 + DEX + Proficiency Bonus, with a Range of 30ft. The discharged card deals 1d6 + MAM magical damage. At Level 5, you add an additional 1d8 to the card's total damage. At Level 10, you double your MAM when dealing damage with your ability.

  • Explosive Trinity

    • As a Full-Round Action, If you have 3 cards in your hand that are from either a matching Triumvirate or 3 Court Cards (belonging to any Era), you may discard those 3 cards from your hand to make 3 Magic Attacks, using 1d20 + MAM + Proficiency Bonus, with a Range of 30ft. Each Magic Attack deals 3d6 + MAM. This damage increases to 3d8 at 5th Level, 3d10 at 10th Level, and 3d12 at 15th Level

  • Cycling the Spell Deck

    • Once your Spell Deck has 0 cards remaining, you may gain 2 Stress Points to shuffle your Discard Pile and create your Spell Deck anew

Release Effect

1

King

The next Leadership Check made by any Magi-Knight gains +X. Also, one target of the caster's choice takes Xd6+MAM magic damage

2

Queen

The next Leadership Check made by any Magi-Knight gains +X. Also, the next successful Magi-Knight Weapon Attack deals an additional Xd6+MAM magic damage

3

Knight

The next Leadership Check made by any Magi-Knight gains +X. Also, reduce the next damage any Magi-Knight takes by Xd8+MAM

4

Dame

The next Leadership Check made by any Magi-Knight gains +X. Also, restore Xd8+MAM HP to one Magi-Knight of your choice

5

Squire

Discard this Spell Card in conjunction with another Spell Card to add 2x your Reputation Level to the Scaling Value

6

Damsel

Discard this Spell Card in conjunction with another Spell Card to add 2x your Reputation Level to the Scaling ValueÂ 

7

Light

After casting this Spell Card, all Magi-Knights within 120 ft of you gain +Xd4+ MAM Temp HP


8


Dark

Cast this Spell Card as a Full-Round Action. After doing so, you restore +X Hit Points, teleport 10 (+X), and cannot be targeted by hostile spells or abilities until the start of your next turn. Your next Discharge Energy action automatically hits and deals an additional +X damage to its target


9


Twilight

Cast this Spell Card as a Bonus Action with no Mana Point Cost. You may exchange an equal number of your Hit Points for Mana Points OR an equal number of your Mana Points for Hit Points

10

Life

After casting this Spell Card, choose one Magi-Knight within 120 ft. That Magi-Knight heals Xd8 + MAM Hit Points and reduces their Stress Points by 1

11

Death

After casting this Spell Card, choose one target or one Horde. That target or all parts of that Horde take +Xd12 + MAM magic damage

12

Passage

After casting this Spell Card, choose one Magi-Knight within 120 ft. You and / or that Magi-Knight may teleport to any location within 10 + (10*X) feet of their current location

13

Angel

After casting this Spell Card, choose one Outsider. That target takes +Xd10 + MAM True Damage

14

Demon

After casting this Spell Card, make a Spell Attack against one target. That target takes +Xd10 + MAM magic damage. This does double damage if the target is a Mortal


15


Mortal

Cast this Spell Card as a Bonus Action that costs 0 MP. After doing so you immediately discard your hand, shuffle all cards in the discard pile into your Spell Deck, remove 1 Stress Point, and draw 2 Spell Cards




16




Hope

After casting this Spell Card, roll the Fate Die:

Â Â 20 = You repair +X Crystalline Fractures to your intended target and remove a combination of Stress and Exhaustion Points equal to +X, split between the two of you

Â Â 6-19 = You repair +X Crystalline Fractures of your target

Â Â 2-5 = You repair +X (Â½) Crystalline Fractures of your target

Â Â 1 = Abandoned. You take +X magic damage. Search your Spell Deck for the Despair Card and add it to your hand




17




Despair

After casting this Spell Card, roll the Fate Die:

Â Â 20 = You may decide to instead play this Spell Card as if it were a copy of the Hope Card and you had rolled 20. If you do so, one Magi-Knight gains an Inspiration Point

Â Â 6-19 = One Mortal [Cultist] target of your choice receives a -X value (minimum 1) to all attacks, rolls to resist, damage, etc. for one turnÂ 

Â Â 2-5 = Your Mana Points used to cast this Spell Card are refunded

Â Â 1 = Anguish. You take +X magic damage, gain the Distressed Condition, and 3 Stress Points. If this would increase your Stress Points beyond 6, you gain 1 Trauma Point



18



Fortune

This Spell Card only affects Magi-Knights. After casting it, roll the Fate Die:

Â Â 20 = The next +(Â½)X d20 rolls receive your MAM (x2) as a Bonus Modifier

Â Â 6-19 = The next +(Â½)X d20 rolls receive your MAM as a Bonus Modifier

Â Â 2-5 = Misfortune. Your next Fate Die is rolled with Disadvantage

Â Â 1 = Calamity. Your next Fate Die is rolled with Disadvantage. You gain 3 Stress Points. If this would increase your Stress Points beyond 6, you gain 1 Trauma Point

19

Justice

After casting this Spell Card, make a Spell Attack against one target. That target takes +Xd12 + MAM magic damage

20

Mercy

After casting this Spell Card, the next Convincing Argument made against any target gains +X to-hit and also deals an additional +X CHP damage

21

Reflection

After casting this Spell Card, one Magi-Knight of your choice gains +Xd4 + Reputation Level (minimum 1) Mana Points up to their maximum






22






Love

Cast this Spell Card for 0 MP and as a Full-Round Action. Afterwards, roll the Fate Die:

Â Â 20 = Eternal. Immediately play 2 Spell Cards, ignoring their Action cost, but still paying their MP cost. One card is returned to your hand after play and this Spell Card is placed into your Discard Pile. Afterwards you draw cards up to your Hand Limit

Â Â 6-19 = Immediately play 2 Spell Cards, ignoring their Action cost, but still paying their MP cost. One card is returned to your hand after play. Afterwards draw one card

Â Â 2-5 = Immediately play 1 Spell Card and ignore its Action cost, but still paying its MP cost. That card is removed from play for the remainder of the Encounter

Â Â 1 =Â  Broken Heart. Discard all Spell Cards from your hand. If there are not at least 11 Spell Cards in your Discard Pile, remove cards from the top of your Spell Deck until there are. Then remove all cards in your Discard Pile from play. You cannot use these cards for the remainder of the Encounter. You additionally gain 1 Trauma Point


Ephemeral. After playing this Spell Card, remove it for the remainder of the Encounter
